title: Could one work in forensics with a biology degree? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, but additional training is required. The forensic departments are lead by Pathologists, Physicians trained in forensics, usually called Medical Examiners. They require a number of assistants to run a variety of tests, in addition to dissecting bodies. There are blood samples and considerable tissue samples to hep identify disease states or individual characteristics such as heavy alcohol use So, yes, a biology degree with additional training can lead to a job in forensics.
Biology is a good start. You would need to do some extra classes, maybe going for at least a master's, in applying biology to forensics.
